text: Jean-Pierre Jaussaud (3 June 1937 â€“ 21 July 2021) was a French racing driver. He was known for winning the 24 Hours of Le Mans in 1978 and 1980. Jaussaud was born in Caen, France. He raced with Formula Three cars. Jaussaud died on 21 July 2021 in Caen of a heart attack, aged 84. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2021 deaths Category:French racecar drivers Category:24 Hours of Le Mans drivers Category:Sportspeople from Normandy Category:People from Caen
title: Jean-Pierre Jaussaud
